explanation: The report is correct. The problematic call is memchr(name_ptr, 0, OS_MAX_FILE_NAME) in OS_TranslatePath (included in the additional code). memchr is allowed to read up to OS_MAX_FILE_NAME bytes starting at name_ptr, but the only precondition computed earlier is VirtPathLen = OS_strnlen(VirtualPath, OS_MAX_PATH_LEN), which only guarantees a terminating '\0' within the first OS_MAX_PATH_LEN bytes of VirtualPath. There is no guarantee that the object backing VirtualPath actually contains OS_MAX_FILE_NAME bytes after name_ptr (the caller may have passed a buffer sized exactly for the string). Thus memchr may access bytes beyond the end of the actual object (undefined behavior), which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. Note: the issue is in OS_TranslatePath (used by OS_ModuleLoad), not in the body of OS_ModuleLoad_Impl itself, but the reported violation is valid for the shown code path.
